subject: Learning
title: Vygotsky and the Zone of Proximal Development
description: A quick, practical guide to Vygotsky and the Zone of Proximal Development.

hook.text: A child can't tie her shoes alone but can with a parent's help. That gap is where learning lives.

buildup.text: Lev Vygotsky called this gap the zone of proximal developmentâ€”just beyond current ability.

discovery.text: Scaffoldingâ€”temporary support from a more capable personâ€”helps learners cross that zone.

twist.text: Vygotsky died at 37. His work was suppressed by Stalin. The West discovered it decades later.

climax.text: His ideas now underpin tutoring, mentoring, and collaborative learning worldwide.

punchline.text: The best teaching happens just beyond what the learner can do alone.

quiz.question: What is the zone of proximal development?
options: The gap between what a learner can do alone and with help
The maximum a student can ever learn
A physical space in the classroom
